audit_summary: Arnos Bistrot has a well-maintained WordPress website with strong desktop performance and excellent Google review signals. The primary opportunity is the absence of an online booking or reservation pathway, which is a clear gap for a hospitality business with demonstrated demand. Secondary improvements to mobile performance and testimonial integration would further strengthen conversion.

performance: Mobile PageSpeed score of 65 indicates moderate performance — possible causes include unoptimised images or render-blocking scripts, though this cannot be confirmed from public signals alone
Desktop PageSpeed score of 98 is strong and suggests the core site build is well-optimised
mobile_ux: Mobile UX is rated ok — the site is usable on mobile but may have friction points such as small tap targets, dense text, or CTA placement that could reduce conversion on smaller screens
Reviewing button sizing, spacing, and CTA prominence on mobile would support the conversion objective
conversion: Contact form is present — basic enquiry pathway is in place
No booking system is present — for a hospitality business this is the most direct conversion gap
No click-to-call functionality was identified in the input signals
seo_fundamentals: No blog or updates section is present — static content structure limits fresh content signals
Notes confirm no dynamic content section, which reduces opportunities for ongoing organic visibility
Location data is available (Westport, Co. Mayo) — local business schema markup would likely improve local search appearance but is not confirmed as present
trust_social_proof: Google rating of 4.9 across 293 reviews is a strong trust signal
Testimonials are manually displayed rather than dynamically embedded — this is a missed opportunity to surface live review data and reduce maintenance overhead
security_maintenance: SSL is active — secure browsing is in place
Site runs on WordPress — keeping themes, plugins, and core updated is recommended as a routine maintenance practice to maintain performance and stability

p1_quick_wins: Add an online booking or reservation system — this is the highest-priority conversion improvement for a hospitality business with strong review demand
Replace manually displayed testimonials with a dynamically embedded Google Reviews widget to surface live social proof without ongoing manual effort
p2_growth_improvements: Investigate and address mobile PageSpeed — image compression and deferring non-critical scripts are common quick gains that could move the score from moderate to strong
Add a click-to-call button visible on mobile — low effort and directly supports conversion for walk-in and reservation enquiries
Implement LocalBusiness and Restaurant schema markup to strengthen local search appearance
p3_strategic_enhancements: Introduce a lightweight specials or events section to generate periodic fresh content — low editorial commitment and supports long-term local SEO visibility

assumptions_and_unknowns: Click-to-call presence was not confirmed in input signals
Social media links and profiles were not included in the input
Full mobile layout details such as font sizes and tap target sizes were not available — mobile UX assessment is based on the provided rating only
next_best_action: Share a short conversion improvement plan focused on booking system integration and propose a 15 minute call to walk through the recommendations
